ground_truth: Zus holds a protective hand in front of his face while people watch in mute shock; Tuvia, with a livid scowl, drops the stone on the ground and gets to his feet, as Zus sits up and wipes his mouth. Straightening his jacket, Zus looks around at the assembled people staring at him, and Benzion picks up his gun. Zus addresses Asael, who's standing with Chaya; the two young people look at each other, and Zus affectionately pats Asael on the cheek. Zus then turns to find Bella standing behind him; without a word, he grabs his machine gun, and with a line of volunteers behind him, strides off past Tuvia. At Nowogrodek, Nazi soldiers stand guard as Jewish men and women wearing yellow stars file into the ghetto, while Tuvia and Asael stride purposefully past the ghetto entrance. They carefully tread along a low-tiled roof, climb down at the far end, and hurry towards the interior of the ghetto. On an unpaved woodland track, the army general Panchenko, astride a tall black horse with Gramov at his side, rides at the head of an infantry column toward Zus and his men standing by the side of the track. Panchenko nods at Zus, who nods back. As the Russian commander moves on, Zus and his men fall in with the Russian foot soldiers. Inside the ghetto, a Jewish elder addresses a room packed with smartly dressed, solemn-looking people. Tuvia addresses two women in the room, then looks despairingly at Asael. A beautiful young woman steps forward. Under a cover of darkness, as people stream out of a house tearing off their yellow stars, one Jewish man hiding in a doorway peers toward the floodlit square where German guards are on duty in front of the barbed wire entrance to the ghetto; he beckons to Asael across the dark narrow street where the people have gathered. Asael ushers them out through a hole in the wall and into the street, leaving behind a pile of yellow fabric stars. At daybreak, carrying bags and cases, they walk in single file across the wintry landscape towards a windmill and on into the Birchwood forest. At the camp, Shimon and Malbin sit behind a makeshift desk on which people are putting their valuables, and she and her parents hug each other. Shimon addresses an elderly man, while Tuvia shows the man a loose trigger on a rifle; the watchmaker hands back the rifle and the trigger works. Tuvia sits on his horse, and young and old listen with rapt attention as Malbin nods approvingly. A curly-haired boy turns to Lilka, the beautiful newcomer, while Asael supervises shooting practice. Elsewhere, women are sitting at sewing machines.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Zus maintains a shielding hand in front of his visage while individuals observe in silent astonishment; Tuvia, with a furious glower, lets the rock fall on the soil and rises to his feet, as Zus sits up and cleans his lips. Straightening his coat, Zus glances around at the gathered individuals gazing at him, and Benzion retrieves his firearm. Zus addresses Asael, who's standing with Chaya; the two youthful individuals gaze at each other, and Zus tenderly pats Asael on the cheek. Zus then turns to find Bella standing behind him; without a word, he seizes his submachine gun, and with a line of volunteers behind him, strides off past Tuvia. At Nowogrodek, Nazi troopers stand sentry as Jewish men and women wearing yellow stars proceed into the ghetto, while Tuvia and Asael march purposefully past the ghetto entrance. They carefully walk along a low-tiled rooftop, descend at the remote end, and hurry towards the interior of the ghetto. On an unpaved forest path, the military general Panchenko, astride a tall black steed with Gramov at his side, rides at the head of a foot troop column toward Zus and his men standing by the side of the path. Panchenko nods at Zus, who nods back. As the Russian leader advances, Zus and his men join the Russian infantry soldiers. Inside the ghetto, a Jewish elder addresses a room packed with smartly attired, grave-looking individuals. Tuvia addresses two women in the room, then looks despairingly at Asael. A beautiful young woman steps forward. Under a cover of darkness, as individuals stream out of a house tearing off their yellow stars, one Jewish man hiding in a doorway peers toward the illuminated square where German guards are on duty in front of the barbed wire entrance to the ghetto; he beckons to Asael across the dark narrow street where the individuals have assembled. Asael ushers them out through a gap in the wall and into the street, leaving behind a heap of yellow fabric stars. At daybreak, carrying bags and cases, they walk in single file across the wintry terrain towards a windmill and on into the Birchwood forest. At the camp, Shimon and Malbin sit behind a makeshift desk on which individuals are putting their valuables, and she and her parents embrace each other. Shimon addresses an elderly man, while Tuvia shows the man a loose trigger on a firearm; the watchmaker hands back the firearm and the trigger functions. Tuvia sits on his steed, and young and old listen with captivated attention as Malbin nods approvingly. A curly-haired boy turns to Lilka, the beautiful newcomer, while Asael supervises shooting practice. Elsewhere, women are seated at sewing machines.

Straightening his jacket, Zus looks around at the assembled people staring at him, and a gun is picked up by Benzion. Zus addresses Asael, who's standing with Chaya; the two young people look at each other, and Asael is affectionately patted on the cheek by Zus. Zus then turns to find Bella standing behind him; without a word, his machine gun is grabbed by him, and with a line of volunteers behind him, Tuvia is walked past as he strides off. At Nowogrodek, the ghetto is filed into by Jewish men and women wearing yellow stars as they are guarded by Nazi soldiers, while Tuvia and Asael stride purposefully past the ghetto entrance. A low-tiled roof is carefully treaded along, they climb down at the far end, and the interior of the ghetto is hurried toward by them. On an unpaved woodland track, the army general Panchenko, astride a tall black horse with Gramov at his side, rides at the head of an infantry column toward Zus and his men standing by the side of the track. Zus nods at Panchenko, who nods back. As the Russian commander moves on, the Russian foot soldiers are joined by Zus and his men. Inside the ghetto, a room packed with smartly dressed, solemn-looking people is addressed by a Jewish elder. Two women in the room are addressed by Tuvia, then Asael is looked at despairingly by him. A beautiful young woman steps forward. Under a cover of darkness, as a house is streamed out of by people tearing off their yellow stars, one Jewish man hiding in a doorway peers toward the floodlit square where German guards are on duty in front of the barbed wire entrance to the ghetto; Asael is beckoned to across the dark narrow street where the people have gathered by him. The people are ushered out through a hole in the wall and into the street by Asael, leaving behind a pile of yellow fabric stars. At daybreak, carrying bags and cases, a single file is walked in by them across the wintry landscape towards a windmill and on into the Birchwood forest. At the camp, Shimon and Malbin sit behind a makeshift desk on which their valuables are being put by people, and she and her parents hug each other. An elderly man is addressed by Shimon, while a loose trigger on a rifle is shown to the man by Tuvia; the rifle is handed back by the watchmaker and the trigger works. Tuvia sits on his horse, and rapt attention is listened with by young and old as Malbin nods approvingly. Lilka, the beautiful newcomer, is turned to by a curly-haired boy, while shooting practice is supervised by Asael. Elsewhere, sewing machines are being sat at by women.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Zus shields his face as people watch in shock. Tuvia, scowling, drops the stone and stands while Zus wipes his mouth and straightens his jacket. Zus looks around at the staring crowd as Benzion picks up his gun. Addressing Asael, who stands with Chaya, Zus pats Asael's cheek. Spotting Bella, he grabs his machine gun and, with volunteers, strides past Tuvia. At Nowogrodek, Nazi soldiers guard as Jews with yellow stars enter the ghetto, while Tuvia and Asael stride past. They tread along a roof, climb down, and hurry into the ghetto. On a woodland track, General Panchenko leads an infantry column where Zus and his men stand. Panchenko nods at Zus, who nods back and joins the Russian soldiers. In the ghetto, a Jewish elder speaks to a solemn crowd. Tuvia talks to two women, then looks at Asael. A young woman steps forward. At night, people remove their yellow stars and exit, while a man peers from a doorway toward German guards. He signals Asael, who guides them through a hole in the wall, leaving yellow stars behind. At daybreak, they carry bags across the wintry landscape toward a windmill and into Birchwood forest. At camp, Shimon and Malbin sit at a makeshift desk as people hand over valuables, and a family hugs. Shimon talks to an elderly man while Tuvia shows him a rifle with a loose trigger; the watchmaker fixes it. Tuvia sits on his horse as attentive listeners surround him with Malbin nodding. A boy looks at Lilka, the newcomer, while Asael supervises shooting practice. Nearby, women sew.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Zus shields his face while others watch silently. Tuvia, scowling, drops the stone and stands as Zus sits up, wipes his mouth, and straightens his jacket. Zus looks at the crowd, while Benzion picks up his gun. Zus speaks to Asael and Chaya, pats Asael's cheek, then turns to see Bella. Without a word, he grabs his machine gun and leads volunteers past Tuvia. At Nowogrodek, Nazi soldiers guard Jews entering the ghetto. Tuvia and Asael stride past, tread along a roof, climb down, and hurry inside. On a woodland track, General Panchenko, on a black horse with Gramov, leads an infantry column toward Zus and his men. Panchenko nods at Zus, who nods back and joins the Russian soldiers. Inside the ghetto, a Jewish elder addresses a serious crowd. Tuvia talks to two women and looks at Asael. A young woman steps forward. At night, people tear off yellow stars and leave a house. A Jewish man in a doorway watches German guards by the ghetto entrance and signals Asael across the street. Asael guides them through a wall hole, leaving stars behind. At daybreak, they walk across a winter landscape toward a windmill and into Birchwood forest. At camp, Shimon and Malbin sit at a desk where people deposit valuables. Shimon speaks to an elderly man as Tuvia shows him a rifle. The watchmaker fixes the trigger. Tuvia, on his horse, addresses a captivated audience as Malbin nods. A boy turns to Lilka, the newcomer, while Asael oversees shooting practice. Nearby, women sew.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Zus, with a cautious and protective hand held in front of his face, stands amidst a scene where onlookers watch in silent, stunned shock. Tuvia, wearing a furious and intense scowl, releases the stone, letting it drop to the ground before rising to his feet. Meanwhile, Zus, who has been knocked down, sits up and methodically wipes his mouth. He then takes a moment to straighten his jacket with a composed demeanor, all the while noticing the crowd of people who are fixated on him. Benzion, maintaining his composure, retrieves his gun from the ground. Zus directs his attention to Asael, who is standing in close proximity with Chaya. The pair of young people exchange meaningful glances, and Zus affectionately pats Asael on the cheek as a sign of camaraderie. Turning his attention elsewhere, Zus spots Bella standing quietly behind him; without exchanging words, he decisively reaches for his machine gun. With a determined expression, he leads a procession of volunteers and confidently strides past Tuvia.

In the grim setting of Nowogrodek, Nazi soldiers maintain a vigilant guard presence while Jewish men and women, identifiable by the yellow stars they wear, slowly file into the ghetto. Simultaneously, Tuvia and Asael walk with a sense of purpose past the entrance to the ghetto. They cautiously and nimbly tread along a low-tiled roof, subsequently climbing down at the distant end, and make haste toward the heart of the ghetto. On a rugged and unpaved woodland track, the army general Panchenko, mounted on a tall, imposing black horse with Gramov accompanying him, leads an infantry column toward Zus and his men who are standing on the sidelines of the track. As Panchenko approaches, he acknowledges Zus with a nod, and Zus reciprocates the gesture. As the Russian commander continues on his path, Zus and his group seamlessly join the ranks of the Russian foot soldiers.

Within the confines of the ghetto, a Jewish elder engages a room filled with elegantly dressed, solemn-faced individuals. Tuvia speaks to two women present in the room and then casts a despairing glance toward Asael. At that moment, a strikingly beautiful young woman steps forward from among the gathered people. Under the shroud of darkness, a quiet exodus begins as individuals stream out of a house, hurriedly tearing off their yellow stars. A Jewish man, concealed in the shadows of a doorway, peers cautiously toward the floodlit square where German guards stand vigilant at the barbed wire entrance to the ghetto. He signals to Asael across the dimly lit, narrow street, where people have congregated. Asael takes charge, guiding them out through a hole in the wall and into the street, leaving behind a heap of yellow fabric stars.

At the break of day, with bags and cases in hand, the group moves in an orderly single file across the wintry landscape. They make their way toward a solitary windmill and then continue into the dense expanse of the Birchwood forest. Upon arriving at the camp, Shimon and Malbin are stationed behind a makeshift desk, where people are placing their valuables. In a touching moment, she and her parents warmly embrace one another. Shimon subsequently addresses an elderly gentleman, while Tuvia shows this man a rifle with a loose trigger; the watchmaker deftly repairs the rifle, ensuring the trigger functions properly now. Tuvia, seated on his horse, commands the attention of the young and the old alike as they listen intently, with Malbin nodding approvingly at what is said. Meanwhile, a curly-haired boy turns his attention to Lilka, who is the strikingly beautiful newcomer to the camp, while Asael oversees shooting practice. In another area, a group of women sits diligently at sewing machines, busily attending to their tasks.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Zus, with an air of caution and a protective hand held firmly in front of his face, finds himself standing amidst a scene where a group of onlookers watch in a silent, stunned shock. Tuvia, wearing a furious and intensely focused scowl, releases the stone from his grasp, letting it fall to the ground before he rises to his feet. Meanwhile, Zus, who has been knocked down, sits up and carefully wipes his mouth. Taking a moment to compose himself, he straightens his jacket with a calm and deliberate demeanor, all the while noticing the crowd of people who remain fixated on him. Maintaining his composure, Benzion retrieves his gun from the ground with an air of nonchalance. Zus then directs his attention toward Asael, who is standing in close proximity with Chaya. This pair of young people exchange meaningful and significant glances, and Zus affectionately pats Asael on the cheek as a sign of camaraderie and solidarity. Turning his attention elsewhere, Zus spots Bella standing quietly and silently behind him; without exchanging any words, he decisively reaches for his machine gun. With a determined expression on his face, he leads a procession of volunteers and confidently strides past Tuvia.

In the grim and unsettling setting of Nowogrodek, Nazi soldiers maintain a vigilant and unwavering guard presence while Jewish men and women, made identifiable by the yellow stars they wear, slowly file into the confines of the ghetto. Simultaneously, Tuvia and Asael walk with a palpable sense of purpose past the entrance to the ghetto. They move cautiously and nimbly as they tread along a low-tiled roof, subsequently climbing down at the distant end, and make haste toward the very heart of the ghetto. On a rugged and unpaved woodland track, the army general Panchenko, mounted atop a tall and imposing black horse with Gramov accompanying him, leads an infantry column toward Zus and his men who are standing on the sidelines of the track. As Panchenko approaches, he acknowledges Zus with a nod, and Zus reciprocates this gesture. As the Russian commander continues on his determined path, Zus and his group seamlessly join the ranks of the Russian foot soldiers, blending in with their march.

Within the confines of the ghetto, a Jewish elder engages a room filled with elegantly dressed, solemn-faced individuals who look on with attentive expressions. Tuvia, addressing two women present in the room, then casts a despairing and heavy-hearted glance toward Asael. At that poignant moment, a strikingly beautiful young woman steps forward from among the gathered people. Under the shroud of darkness that envelops the scene, a quiet exodus begins as individuals stream out of a house, hurriedly tearing off their yellow stars in a bid for freedom. A Jewish man, concealed within the shadows of a doorway, peers cautiously and with great attention toward the floodlit square where sharp-eyed German guards stand vigilant at the barbed wire entrance to the ghetto. He signals to Asael across the dimly lit, narrow street, where people have congregated. Asael takes charge of the situation, guiding them out through a hole in the wall and into the street, leaving behind a heap of discarded yellow fabric stars.

At the break of day, with bags and cases in hand, the group moves in an orderly and disciplined single file across the wintry landscape. They make their way toward a solitary windmill and then continue into the dense expanse of the Birchwood forest. Upon arriving at the camp, Shimon and Malbin are stationed behind a makeshift desk, where people are placing their valuables with care. In a touching and heartfelt moment, she and her parents warmly embrace one another. Shimon subsequently addresses an elderly gentleman, while Tuvia shows this man a rifle with a loose and malfunctioning trigger; the watchmaker deftly repairs the rifle, ensuring that the trigger functions properly now. Tuvia, seated firmly on his horse, commands the attention of the young and the old alike as they listen intently, with Malbin nodding approvingly at what is being said. Meanwhile, a curly-haired boy turns his attention toward Lilka, who is the strikingly beautiful newcomer to the camp, while Asael oversees shooting practice with a keen eye. In another area, a group of women sits diligently at sewing machines, busily and attentively attending to their tasks with precision.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Zus instinctively raises a protective hand in front of his face, shielding himself from any potential threat, while people around him stand in mute shock, observing the scene unfold. Tuvia, his face contorted with a livid scowl, releases his grip on the stone, allowing it to fall to the ground before he pushes himself up from his position. Zus, sitting up from where he was, uses the back of his hand to wipe his mouth, indicating a sense of composure after the incident. He then takes a moment to straighten his jacket, adjusting it neatly, as his eyes scan the crowd of assembled people, taking in the various expressions of those staring at him. Benzion, meanwhile, bends down to retrieve his gun from the ground, ensuring he is prepared for what might come next. Zus turns his attention to Asael, who stands nearby with Chaya; the two young people exchange a look, a silent communication passing between them, before Zus affectionately pats Asael on the cheek, a gesture of reassurance and camaraderie. With a decisive movement, Zus then turns to find Bella standing quietly behind him; he says nothing but reaches out to firmly grasp his machine gun. With a sense of purpose, Zus strides forward, a line of volunteers falling into step behind him, as they all pass by Tuvia, marking the transition to their next mission. At Nowogrodek, the scene shifts to Nazi soldiers standing guard, their presence imposing as Jewish men and women, marked by yellow stars, file into the ghetto in a subdued procession. Meanwhile, Tuvia and Asael maintain a purposeful stride, moving past the entrance to the ghetto with focused determination. Their path takes them carefully along a low-tiled roof, each step deliberate to maintain balance, before they find a place to climb down at the far end, their movements quickening as they hurry towards the interior of the ghetto. On a separate scene set within a woodland track, army general Panchenko is mounted atop a tall black horse, with Gramov riding beside him, leading an infantry column moving steadily toward Zus and his men who stand strategically by the side of the track. Panchenko acknowledges Zus with a nod, a gesture reciprocated by Zus before the Russian commander moves forward, his men following in disciplined ranks as Zus and his men seamlessly integrate with the Russian foot soldiers. Inside the ghetto, a Jewish elder stands as the central figure addressing a room filled with smartly dressed individuals whose faces reflect solemn determination. Tuvia, within this gathering, engages in conversation with two women, his expression turning to one of despair when he turns his gaze to Asael. As the meeting progresses, a beautiful young woman steps forward, drawing attention to her presence. Under the cloak of darkness, the atmosphere fills with urgency as people rush out of a house, hastily tearing off their yellow stars in defiance. In the shadows, a Jewish man, concealed in a doorway, keeps a vigilant watch toward the brightly lit square where German guards stand at attention in front of the barbed wire entrance to the ghetto. With a calculated and discreet gesture, he beckons to Asael, who stands across the narrow, dark street where people have gathered in anticipation. Asael acts swiftly, guiding the group through a hole in the wall and out into the street, each person leaving behind a symbolic pile of yellow fabric stars. As day breaks, signaling a new chapter, the group marches in single file across the stark, wintry landscape, their footsteps forming a path towards a distant windmill and continuing into the welcoming embrace of the Birchwood forest. At the camp, an air of activity fills the space as Shimon and Malbin take their positions behind a makeshift desk, a steady stream of people approaching to place their valuables upon it. Among them, a family shares a heartfelt embrace, capturing a moment of familial connection amidst the chaos. Shimon then addresses an elderly man, offering guidance, while Tuvia demonstrates a loose trigger on a rifle, receiving the weapon back from the watchmaker, who has deftly restored it to working condition. Tuvia takes his place on horseback, where he becomes the focus of attention, his words captivating the young and old who listen intently, with Malbin nodding approvingly at his side. Nearby, a curly-haired boy turns to Lilka, the beautiful newcomer, their interaction hinting at budding relationships, while Asael takes charge of supervising shooting practice, ensuring everyone gains the skills necessary for survival. Elsewhere within the camp, women sit at sewing machines, their hands working diligently to produce garments, a testament to resilience and adaptation amidst adversity.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Zus, shielding his face amid silent onlookers, observes Tuvia's anger as he discards a stone and rises. Nearby, Zus regains composure, acknowledges the crowd, and retrieves his machine gun with volunteers in tow, moving past Tuvia. In Nowogrodek, Nazi guards oversee Jewish citizens entering the ghetto marked by yellow stars, while Tuvia and Asael discreetly traverse a rooftop and enter the ghetto's interior. Meanwhile, General Panchenko, on horseback with Gramov, leads an infantry column past Zus and his men, who join the Russian soldiers after a mutual nod. Inside the ghetto, an elder speaks to a serious congregation as Tuvia directs two women and exchanges a despondent glance with Asael, while a young woman steps forward. Under cover of darkness, as people discard their yellow stars, a hidden man signals Asael across the street. Asael guides them through a wall opening, leaving the yellow fabric behind as they escape. By dawn, the group, carrying their belongings, treks in single file through the snowy landscape towards the Birchwood forest. At the camp, Shimon and Malbin oversee the collection of valuables, and families embrace. Shimon speaks to an older man while Tuvia fixes a rifle's trigger with the man's help. Mounted on his horse, Tuvia addresses an attentive crowd. Asael oversees shooting practice, and women work diligently at sewing machines as a curly-haired boy turns towards Lilka, the new arrival.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Zus holds a protective hand in front of his face while people watch in mute shock; Tuvia, with a livid scowl, drops the stone on the ground and gets to his feet, as Zus sits up and wipes his mouth. Straightening his jacket, Zus looks around at the assembled people staring at him, and Benzion, a skilled marksman known for his sharp aim, picks up his gun. Zus addresses Asael, who's standing with Chaya, a resilient woman known for her unwavering spirit; the two young people look at each other, and Zus affectionately pats Asael on the cheek. Zus then turns to find Bella, his close confidante who has been with him through many struggles, standing behind him; without a word, he grabs his machine gun, a Soviet-made PPSh-41 often used by partisans during World War II, and with a line of volunteers behind him, strides off past Tuvia. At Nowogrodek, a town in Nazi-occupied Poland known for its significant Jewish population before the war, Nazi soldiers stand guard as Jewish men and women wearing yellow stars, a symbol imposed by the Nazis for identifying Jews, file into the ghetto, while Tuvia and Asael stride purposefully past the ghetto entrance. They carefully tread along a low-tiled roof, climb down at the far end, and hurry towards the interior of the ghetto. On an unpaved woodland track, the army general Panchenko, a seasoned leader in the Soviet military, astride a tall black horse with Gramov at his side, rides at the head of an infantry column toward Zus and his men standing by the side of the track. Panchenko nods at Zus, who nods back. As the Russian commander moves on, Zus and his men fall in with the Russian foot soldiers, forming a united front against the common enemy. Inside the ghetto, a Jewish elder, known for his wisdom and leadership in the community, addresses a room packed with smartly dressed, solemn-looking people. Tuvia addresses two women in the room, then looks despairingly at Asael. A beautiful young woman steps forward, her courage shining through the oppressive atmosphere. Under a cover of darkness, as people stream out of a house tearing off their yellow stars, one Jewish man hiding in a doorway peers toward the floodlit square where German guards are on duty in front of the barbed wire entrance to the ghetto; he beckons to Asael across the dark narrow street where the people have gathered. Asael ushers them out through a hole in the wall and into the street, leaving behind a pile of yellow fabric stars, a symbol of their defiance and determination for freedom. At daybreak, carrying bags and cases, they walk in single file across the wintry landscape towards a windmill, a landmark used for hiding and orientation, and on into the Birchwood forest. At the camp, Shimon and Malbin sit behind a makeshift desk on which people are putting their valuables, an effort to establish a sense of order and community; she and her parents hug each other. Shimon addresses an elderly man, while Tuvia shows the man a loose trigger on a rifle; the watchmaker, known for his precision and skill, hands back the rifle and the trigger works, demonstrating the resourcefulness and adaptability within the camp. Tuvia sits on his horse, and young and old listen with rapt attention as Malbin nods approvingly. A curly-haired boy turns to Lilka, the beautiful newcomer whose bravery has inspired many, while Asael supervises shooting practice. Elsewhere, women are sitting at sewing machines, repurposing materials to support their community's needs.

test_cases.description: Zus holds a protective hand in front of his face while people watch in mute shock. Tuvia with a livid scowl drops the stone on the ground and gets to his feet as Zus sits up and wipes his mouth. Straightening his jacket Zus looks around at the assembled people staring at him and Benzion picks up his gun. Zus addresses Asael who is standing with Chaya. the two young people look at each other and Zus affectionately pats Asael on the cheek. Zus then turns to find Bella standing behind him without a word. he grabs his machine gun and with a line of volunteers behind him strides off past Tuvia. At Nowogrodek Nazi soldiers stand guard as Jewish men and women wearing yellow stars file into the ghetto while Tuvia and Asael stride purposefully past the ghetto entrance. They carefully tread along a lowtiled roof climb down at the far end and hurry towards the interior of the ghetto. On an unpaved woodland track the army general Panchenko astride a tall black horse with Gramov at his side rides at the head of an infantry column toward Zus and his men standing by the side of the track. Panchenko nods at Zus who nods back. As the Russian commander moves on Zus and his men fall in with the Russian foot soldiers. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. Inside the ghetto a Jewish elder addresses a room packed with smartly dressed solemnlooking people. Tuvia addresses two women in the room then looks despairingly at Asael. A beautiful young woman steps forward. Under a cover of darkness as people stream out of a house tearing off their yellow stars one Jewish man hiding in a doorway peers toward the floodlit square where German guards are on duty in front of the barbed wire entrance to the ghetto. he beckons to Asael across the dark narrow street where the people have gathered. Asael ushers them out through a hole in the wall and into the street leaving behind a pile of yellow fabric stars. At daybreak carrying bags and cases they walk in single file across the wintry landscape towards a windmill and on into the Birchwood forest. At the camp Shimon and Malbin sit behind a makeshift desk on which people are putting their valuables and she and her parents hug each other. Shimon addresses an elderly man while Tuvia shows the man a loose trigger on a rifle. the watchmaker hands back the rifle and the trigger works. Tuvia sits on his horse and young and old listen with rapt attention as Malbin nods approvingly. A curlyhaired boy turns to Lilka the beautiful newcomer while Asael supervises shooting practice. Elsewhere women are sitting at sewing machines.

Tuvia sits on his horse and young and old listen with rapt attention as Malbin nods approvingly. A curlyhaired boy turns to Lilka the beautiful newcomer while Asael supervises shooting practice. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Rex places a gentle paw over his whiskers while creatures blink in surprise; Max, with a furious frown, sets the pebble on the rug and leaps to his paws, as Rex reclines and brushes his snout. Adjusting his sweater, Rex glances around at the gathered creatures gawking at him, and Gideon grabs his telescope. Rex calls out to Orion, who's lounging with Luna; the two young beings glance at each other, and Rex tenderly taps Orion on the shoulder. Rex then swivels to find Nova standing beside him; without a sound, he reaches for his slingshot, and with a group of allies trailing him, marches off past Max. At Mariposa, alien scouts stand post as robotic entities adorned with silver emblems meander into the dome, while Max and Orion march confidently past the dome's opening. They gingerly tiptoe along a low-curved branch, slide down at the distant tip, and dash towards the heart of the dome. On a dusty jungle path, the space commander Vega, perched on a giant green beetle with Zephyr at his wing, cruises at the front of a drone fleet toward Rex and his squad lingering by the edge of the path. Vega winks at Rex, who winks back. As the Martian guide drifts on, Rex and his squad join the Martian walkers. Inside the dome, a robotic elder announces in a chamber filled with elegantly attired, serious-looking beings. Max speaks to two creatures in the chamber, then gazes mournfully at Orion. A graceful young being steps forward. Under a veil of twilight, as entities drift out of a structure removing their silver emblems, one robotic man concealed in an archway glances toward the illuminated plaza where Elysian watchers are stationed before the electrified gate to the dome; he motions to Orion across the obscure alley where the beings have assembled. Orion guides them out through an opening in the barrier and into the alley, leaving behind a heap of silver cloth emblems. At dawn, hefting parcels and crates, they trek in a line across the frosty terrain towards a lighthouse and further into the Redwood jungle. At the hideout, Ariel and Clover sit behind a rudimentary table over which beings are placing their trinkets, and she and her siblings embrace each other. Ariel addresses a venerable creature, while Max indicates the creature a loose cord on a crossbow; the clockmaker returns the crossbow and the cord functions. Max perches on his beetle, and young and old listen with keen interest as Clover smiles approvingly. A curly-haired youth turns to Luna, the graceful stranger, while Orion oversees archery sessions. Elsewhere, beings are sitting at painting easels.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Zus shields himself as Tuvia angrily drops a stone and stands, while Zus wipes his mouth and straightens his jacket. Addressing Asael and Chaya, Zus affectionately pats Asael before grabbing his machine gun, leading volunteers past Tuvia. In Nowogrodek, Jewish people enter the ghetto guarded by Nazis as Tuvia and Asael sneak past the entrance, moving toward the ghetto's interior. On a wooded track, General Panchenko acknowledges Zus, who joins the Russian soldiers. Inside the ghetto, a Jewish elder speaks to a somber crowd. Tuvia talks to two women, glancing hopelessly at Asael. A woman steps forward, and under darkness, Jewish people remove their yellow stars. Asael guides them through a hole in the wall, leaving stars behind. At dawn, the group walks across a snowy landscape into Birchwood forest. At camp, Shimon and Malbin collect valuables. Tuvia gets a rifle fixed by a watchmaker. Tuvia addresses the group on horseback as Malbin nods. A boy looks at Lilka, the newcomer, and Asael oversees shooting practice, while women sew.
